title: Public transport for the NRL Round 1 – Melbourne Storm v Penrith Panthers: Friday 8th March 2024
articleContent:
Public transport for the NRL Round 1 – Melbourne Storm v Penrith Panthers: Friday 8th March 2024

NRL is back at AAMI Park. This matchup is sure to deliver edge-of-your-seat action. Public transport is your best way to enjoy it, as the Melbourne Storm takes on the Penrith Panthers. Extra services will help you get to and from AAMI Park on Friday 8th March.

The event will begin at 8:05pm.

Before you travel

Plan your journey using Journey planner and check Disruptions for service changes that may affect your journey.

 Metropolitan train

Return service from Richmond Station

  • Sandringham – leaving at 10:14pm from Platform 2
  • Glen Waverley – leaving at 10:20pm from Platform 10
  • Pakenham – leaving at 10:21pm from Platform 6
  • Frankston – leaving at 10:28pm from Platform 4
  • Lilydale – leaving at 10:30pm from Platform 9

 Metropolitan tram

Getting to and from AAMI Park

Route 70

  • Trams will operate from Flinders Street / Elizabeth Street (Stop 4) and Stop 7C MCG/John Cain Arena.

Plan your journey using Journey planner.

 Metropolitan bus

Passengers can catch the following buses close to AAMI Park:

  • Route 246

Please note, services may terminate prior to the end of the match.

Plan your journey using Journey planner.

 Regional train

Passengers travelling by regional train can alight at Southern Cross Station, change to a metropolitan train service and alight at Richmond or Flinders Street stations.

Refer to the Metropolitan trains section above for service times and platform information.

Plan your journey using Journey planner.
articleDescription: NRL is back at AAMI Park. This matchup is sure to deliver edge-of-your-seat action. Public transport is your best way to enjoy it, as the Melbourne Storm takes on the Penrith Panthers. Extra services will help you get to and from AAMI Park on Friday 8th March.
